title: Ashley Graham Just Became the First Plus-Sized Model in History to Walk at Michael Kors
text:
February 15, 2017 Getty Images Ashley Graham, who made history last year becoming the first curvy model to appear on the cover of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition , just had another historic first, walking in the Michael Kors fall 2017 fashion show. "You have no idea [how excited I am]," the model told Allure backstage. "This is my biggest show I’ve ever walked in, so I’m a little nervous. I'm trying to get that whole walk like a boy, keep-my-hips-and-head-contained thing down. Usually, it's always super-sexy for me, and this is like fashion fashion." Graham went on to say that although Kors isn’t the first mainstream designer to include diverse bodies in a runway presentation—Christian Siriano cast five plus-sized models last season and ten this one, and Prabal Garung just announced a plus-sized collaboration with Lane Bryant —it's still a momentous occasion. "Fashion isn't such a small world anymore. It's broadening into all kinds of beauty. It's about race, it's about size, it's about age. And when a designer isn't just talking about it, but they're putting their money where their mouth is? I think that’s the most beautiful thing," she said. You May Also Like Fashion This Woman Just Exposed Vanity Sizing In the Best Way Of course, all Graham's nerves settled when she took her first step. (The model told us that the designer had reassured her, “You’re here for a reason. You’ve got this.”) Graham wore a black knit dress with a thigh-high slit, topped with a gray furry shrug. And she didn’t stumble, slip, or stutter. And we weren’t one bit surprised. 
Model Ashley Graham poses backstage before the Michael Kors Collection fall 2017 runway show. Getty Images Graham has had many achievements in her career—from giving a Tedx talk denouncing the term "plus-sized," to being one of the first curve models to be signed by the mainstream modeling IMG, to designing a lingerie collection with Addition Elle —but in our March issue, she wasn't afraid to say that she still was seeking validation from the fashion world at large. "Riccardo Tisci, call me!" she joked in our pages, pointing out that luxury fashion houses like Givenchy still hadn't given curvy models a nod. Well guess what? Michael Kors just called—and Graham answered with aplomb. More groundbreaking NYFW coverage to not miss:
